security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation (SKILL.md) describing a session resume workflow. No executable code exists. The static analyzer generated false positives by misidentifying plain text as cryptographic algorithms and markdown syntax as shell commands. All 30 findings are dismissed as false positives.

content.value_statement: Lose track of your work when switching Claude Code windows? This skill helps you resume saved sessions and continue unfinished tasks seamlessly. List pending sessions, load task context, and track progress until completion.
actual_capabilities: Lists all saved sessions from docs/context-sessions directory
Displays session contents with pending task details
Provides workflow for resuming and continuing work
Updates session progress after completing each task
Removes session files when all tasks are finished
Includes command shortcuts for quick actions
limitations: Requires context-save skill to create initial sessions
Only works with markdown session files in specified directory
Manual workflow execution - no automation of file operations
Documentation is in Chinese with Chinese output

use_cases.title: Continue interrupted coding sessions
use_cases.description: Pick up where you left off when switching between Claude Code windows or after interruptions.

use_cases.title: Track multi-task workflows
use_cases.description: Manage multiple concurrent tasks and switch between them without losing context or progress.

use_cases.title: Share session state
use_cases.description: Collaborate on complex tasks by saving and resuming sessions across different team members.

best_practices: Update session files immediately after completing each task
Use descriptive session names with dates for easy identification
Delete sessions only after confirming all tasks are complete
anti_patterns: Do not leave sessions open indefinitely without progress updates
Avoid creating too many parallel sessions to prevent confusion
Do not modify session files manually outside the workflow

faq.question: What does this skill do?
faq.answer: It helps you resume saved Claude Code sessions by listing pending work, loading task context, and tracking progress.

faq.question: How do I create sessions?
faq.answer: Use the context-save skill first to save your current session before switching contexts.

faq.question: Where are sessions stored?
faq.answer: Sessions are stored as markdown files in the docs/context-sessions/ directory of your project.

faq.question: Can I share sessions with teammates?
faq.answer: Yes, sessions are markdown files that can be shared and resumed by any team member.

faq.question: When are session files deleted?
faq.answer: Session files are automatically deleted only when all listed tasks have been marked complete.

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Claude Code versions?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill works with any Claude Code installation as it provides documentation-based workflow guidance.
